title: Patrick Shepherd
text:
Patrick Lindesay Crawford Shepherd (17 March 1831 – 3 July 1903) was an Australian politician.
He was born in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a> to nurseryman Thomas Shepherd and Jane Henderson. He was a stockman before joining his father at their nursery at <a href="Newtown%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newtown</a>. He established his own seed and plant business. On 19 May 1857 he married Isabella Deane, with whom he had ten children; a second marriage, around 1875 to Sarah Jane Una Barnier, produced a further seven children. He joined the Volunteer Artillery in 1861, retiring a <a href="major%20%28rank%29">major</a> in 1876. In 1874 he was elected to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Legislative%20Assembly">New South Wales Legislative Assembly</a> for <a href="Electoral%20district%20of%20Nepean%20%28New%20South%20Wales%29">Nepean</a>, but he retired in 1877. In 1888 he was appointed to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Legislative%20Council">New South Wales Legislative Council</a>, where he remained until his death at <a href="Burwood%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Burwood</a> in 1903.
